intro: Malabaila numidica, commonly known as the Numidian mallow, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy pink or purple flowers and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Malabaila numidica is valued for its ornamental beauty and traditional uses in herbal medicine.
